entry.title: Book: The Last Days of Socrates, by Plato with Christopher Rowe (2010)
entry.content:
Book: The Last Days of Socrates, by Plato with Christopher Rowe (2010)20160220
I've been reading this for a while. I just finished Socrates'
defense. It's quite sad and defeatist.
  • Books
  • 2010

entry.title: Movie: Run All Night, starring Liam Neeson (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Run All Night, starring Liam Neeson (2015)20160217
This was an intense movie. I liked the plot and how quickly things
went bad in a believable way. I enjoyed the moments with the family
and the plodding acknowledgment of everyone of what was going to
happen. I dislike that there was no resolution of the dirty cops.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: The Intern, starring Robert De Niro (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: The Intern, starring Robert De Niro (2015)20160216
This was a very cute movie. I'm surprised at how good it was. I
thought the ending was a bit too quick and I didn't find it
believable that Jules were make up with her husband so quickly. I
think it would have been slightly better if they had not actually
wanted an old person, but that Ben was confused by the
advertisement. I think the nods to feminism were a bit odd and
inconsistent.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.content:
Game: Downwell (Steam, 2015) (4)20160215
I did a few runs but still didn't get past the first area. I'm
trying to go very slow and get lots of gems rather than just
rushing down, but it doesn't seem to be that much more successful.

Total time: 2:03

entry.title: Game: Super Mario 3D World (WiiU, 2013) (8)
entry.content:
Game: Super Mario 3D World (WiiU, 2013) (8)20160215
We finished World 4 and did a few levels of the next World. We
couldn't get a flag pole in World 4 nor find a stamp. The game is
so fun! It's even better to be playing with my wife.

Total time: 7:39

entry.title: Movie: Speed Racer, starring Emile Hirsch (2008)
entry.content:
Movie: Speed Racer, starring Emile Hirsch (2008)20160215
This movie is so amazing. I like the way it is good for a
family. The visuals are so insane. I like how it subtly includes
all the weird themed racers from the Speed Racer world. It's cool
throughout.
  • Movies
  • 2008

entry.title: Movie: Fantastic Four, starring Miles Teller (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Fantastic Four, starring Miles Teller (2015)20160214
There were some things I really like about this movie: it was dark
and made becoming transformed a scary experience for the characters
and it really developed the place and setting of the quantum
gate. There were lots of lame things about it though... for
instance, why do they even want to go to this Planet Zero? It's one
thing to just want to explore (that'd be fine) but they seem to
think there's some great resource there. Dr. Doom is very poorly
developed as well. The last act of the movie is too quick and
un-interesting as the characters basically attack twice with their
powers: once where they fail and then once where they
succeed. There's no spectacle and enjoyment of their abilities.

I dislike that there's no explanation of what Reed is doing and no
speculation about how they go their powers or what Planet Zero is.

It's fascinating reading about the reshoots.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: An American Tail: Fievel Goes West, directed by Phil Nibbelink (1991)
entry.content:
Movie: An American Tail: Fievel Goes West, directed by Phil Nibbelink (1991)20160213
We watched this as a family. It was pretty cute and I think better
than the first one in many ways. This is the one that I watched
most as a kid, so I think I like it mostly because of nostalgia.
  • Movies
  • 1991

entry.title: The X-Files - Season 1 - Episode 15 - Lazarus
entry.content:
The X-Files - Season 1 - Episode 15 - Lazarus20160212
This was an okay one. I thought a lot of the sets were really
lame. It's really interesting to compare episodes like this from
the first season with all the other seasons because they rarely
bring in people from the character's pasts. Lulu was cold.
  • TV Shows
  • The X-Files

entry.title: The X-Files - Season 1 - Episode 16 - Young at Heart
entry.content:
The X-Files - Season 1 - Episode 16 - Young at Heart20160212
This was a pretty creepy one. I thought the weird hand was
under-utilized and not even really noticed by the characters. A
lot of the story was also very predictable.

  • The X-Files
